intro: Achyranthes puberula, commonly known as the hairy knotweed, is a herbaceous annual plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the Polygonaceae family, characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and clusters of small, greenish flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–100 cm, with hairy stems and leaves that have a rough texture. Its flowers are usually arranged in dense, spike-like inflorescences, and it produces small, three-lobed fruits. Achyranthes puberula is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of environmental conditions.
